extras.old_content:
def get_backend():
    """
    Return the name of the current backend.

    See Also
    --------
    matplotlib.use
    """
    return rcParams['backend']
extras.new_content:
def get_backend():
    """
    Return the name of the current backend.

    This function intentionally avoids resolving the special ``_auto_backend_sentinel``
    by using the underlying dict.__getitem__ to prevent side effects such as
    switching backends and closing figures when merely querying the current
    backend.

    See Also
    --------
    matplotlib.use
    """
    backend = dict.__getitem__(rcParams, 'backend')
    return None if backend is rcsetup._auto_backend_sentinel else backend
extras.diff:
--- /workspace/matplotlib/lib/matplotlib/__init__.py
+++ /workspace/matplotlib/lib/matplotlib/__init__.py
@@ -1173,0 +1174,5 @@
+    This function intentionally avoids resolving the special ``_auto_backend_sentinel``
+    by using the underlying dict.__getitem__ to prevent side effects such as
+    switching backends and closing figures when merely querying the current
+    backend.
+
@@ -1178 +1183,2 @@
-    return rcParams['backend']
+    backend = dict.__getitem__(rcParams, 'backend')
+    return None if backend is rcsetup._auto_backend_sentinel else backend
